safety_edibility_notes: Highly endangered protected species. Killing a panda in China is punishable by death or life imprisonment.
safety_warning_text: Despite their cuddly appearance, giant pandas are bears with powerful jaws and claws. Attacks on humans are rare but have occurred, mostly on keepers or intruders into enclosures.
safety_summary: Giant pandas are generally non-aggressive but are still wild bears capable of causing serious injury. Most dangerous when cornered, protecting cubs, or habituated to humans.
safety_contraindications: Do not approach wild or captive pandas
Do not attempt to touch or pet
encounter_protocol: Observe from distance. Do not approach. If encountered in wild, back away slowly. Allow panda to retreat.
legal_protection_status: CITES Appendix I, National Treasure of China, maximum penalties for poaching
